Job Title: Head of AI & Data Privacy Risk
Ad Text:

Parramatta (Hybrid – 1 day per week in Sydney CBD) 

Shape the future of responsible AI and data governance at MUFG Pension & Market Services (MPMS).

We’re seeking an accomplished and forward-thinking risk leader to design and drive our enterprise-wide strategy for AI, Machine Learning, and Data Privacy Risk Management — ensuring innovation remains ethical, secure, and compliant across multiple jurisdictions.

About the Role

As the Head of AI & Data Privacy Risk, you will lead the second line of defence (L2) in establishing frameworks and controls that define what safe and responsible AI looks like.
Working across Technology, Legal, Risk, Data Science, and Business units, you’ll build the governance structures and oversight that ensure AI and data use are aligned with regulatory expectations, privacy standards, and organisational values.

This is an enterprise-wide leadership role with exposure across Australia, the UK, EU, India, and Hong Kong, requiring a deep understanding of global regulatory frameworks and cross-border data requirements.

Key Responsibilities
Develop and implement an enterprise-wide AI and Data Privacy Risk Framework aligned to global standards (e.g. GDPR, DORA, APRA CPS 234/230).
Lead the design and adoption of AI governance policies, including algorithmic accountability, bias mitigation, and responsible model usage.
Provide L2 oversight of AI risk and information security assessments, ensuring effective controls across the AI lifecycle (design, training, deployment, monitoring).
Oversee data lineage, governance, and quality frameworks ensuring responsible data use in AI systems.
Manage privacy by design and ensure compliance with PII and cross-border data transfer requirements.
Lead Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) and guide responses to regulatory inquiries or incidents.
Partner with business and technology teams to strengthen AI controls and ensure the ethical use of generative AI, chatbots, and automation technologies.
Support uplift in AI risk literacy and promote a culture of transparency, ethics, and accountability.
Lead and develop a team of 3–4 experienced professionals
About You

You’re a seasoned risk leader who combines strategic oversight with hands-on capability. You understand the technical, regulatory, and ethical dimensions of AI and data — and are passionate about enabling innovation safely.

You’ll bring:

12+ years’ experience in Technology or Security Risk Management, ideally in financial services.
Proven experience leading AI and Data Risk frameworks across multiple jurisdictions (UK, EU, India, Australia, HK).
Deep understanding of AI governance, algorithmic risk, bias, and responsible AI model development.
Knowledge of cross-border data privacy and global regulatory frameworks (GDPR, DORA, APRA, FCA, PRA, HKMA).
Qualifications in IT, Computer Science, or Information Security (postgraduate desirable).
Certifications such as CRISC, CISM, CISA, CISSP, ISO 27001/42001 Lead Auditor are advantageous.
Exceptional stakeholder engagement, leadership, and influencing skills — able to operate both strategically and tactically.
What’s it like to work here?

We’re proud to have created a culture that values diversity, inclusion, flexibility, and blended working.
At MPMS, we believe in being open, transparent, and supportive, genuinely caring about the health and wellbeing of our people.

Joining MUFG Pension & Market Services Group means becoming part of an organisation that fosters continuous learning and development, giving you the tools and support you need for both career growth and personal fulfilment.

We offer a range of benefits, including:

Salary sacrificing via superannuation
Paid parental leave scheme
Employee discounts, including health insurance
Hybrid working model
Volunteer and Wellbeing Leave
Why Join Us?

At MPMS, you’ll be part of a purpose-driven organisation committed to innovation, integrity, and the responsible use of emerging technologies.
This is a unique opportunity to shape enterprise-wide AI governance and build a function that defines what responsible AI and data privacy look like across multiple regions and regulatory environments.

Apply now to lead the next chapter of AI and Data Privacy Risk management at MPMS.

Company: Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission
Ad Text:
About the Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission

The Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission (the Commission) was formed on 1 January 2019. We work to improve the lives of older people by maintaining the integrity of the aged care system.

As the single independent regulator of Australian Government aged care services, we offer a variety of interesting and challenging jobs across most capital cities.

It is an exciting time to join the Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission, with major reforms underway to improve aged care in Australia. You will be contributing to our role as the national regulator to safeguard and protect older Australians receiving aged care services.

More information about the role, vision and people of the Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission can be found on our website.

About the Team

The SIRS PPI branch supports the Commission’s purpose through a strong focus on improved sector engagement and reporting relating to the SIRS by:

strengthening the engagement approach to provide improved advice and education about SIRS reporting
targeted insights reporting to support the sector to prevent and manage serious incidents
redesigning the SIRS form to provide more clarity and improve the quality of reporting
leverage the Commission’s maturing analytics capability to develop further insights into sector-level, segmented and provider-level trends and systemic issues.

The SIRS is an initiative to help prevent and reduce the risk and occurrence of incidents of abuse and neglect of older Australians receiving Commonwealth-subsidised aged care and services.

About the Role

The EL2 Directors (multiple) within the SIRS PPI branch work in close partnership to support the Assistant Commissioner SIRS PPI, to deliver the selected areas of the program. 

The Directors will each lead a small team across either Analytics and Insights, Engagement and Sector Capability, and SIRS Form Redesign. Together the teams will engage with areas across the Commission and the sector to deliver on aspects of the program. 

Position Details:

Undertake effective planning and coordinating of activities to successfully deliver program outcomes. 
Work closely with the Assistant Commissioner SIRS PPI to identify program priorities. 
Align project delivery and planning to the broader program objectives and delivery approach. 
Day-to-day leadership and management of program initiatives and operational deliverables. 
Monitor and track progress, risks, issues and dependencies, and provide regular reports to the Assistant Commissioner SIRS PPI, working group and working sub-groups, governing forums and key stakeholders. 
Manage risks and issues including mitigation and escalation activities where required. 
Lead data-driven initiatives and effectively communicate data analytics and findings. 
Drive improvements in data and intelligence capability across the SIRS, including the use of data, information and intelligence in decision making. 
Ensure effective and accurate data capture to enable risk modelling and analysis of trends. 
Undertakes objective, critical analysis and distils the core issues. 
Develop content and coordinate stakeholder engagement activities to ensure adequate input is maintained across the Commission. 
Build strong relationships and effective communications with key internal and external stakeholders. 
Support the Assistant Commissioner SIRS PPI to maintain and develop workforce capability and capacity. 
Adhere to the APS Values and Code of Conduct. 

Key Capabilities:

Navigate strategic context - understand the environmental and broader policy landscape, identify opportunities, distil key issues and determine priorities. 
Think critically - assess the implications of Commission, Government and Sector changes that may impact the SIRS program and develop cogent insights to inform policy and program advice. 
Communication – have excellent written skills to develop program content and briefs. In addition to advanced verbal communication skills for presentation and public speaking in open forums and with providers.  
Analyse information - candidates should have the capability to analyse information and data inputs, distil key messages and adapt delivery in an engaging and creative manner to influence varied audiences. 
Lead teams and provide expert advice - lead and build high performing teams, provide strategic direction; allocate resources effectively and respond flexibly to changing demands; provide subject matter expertise to achieve outcomes. 
Deliver outcomes - work in a fast-paced environment with ambiguity. Candidates need to demonstrate self-motivation, initiative and the willingness and ability to lead and drive initiatives. 
Excellent relationship management skills – be comfortable with collaboration and be able to work with people with different perspectives to achieve outcomes. 
Leadership – be proactive, innovative and inclusive. The successful candidate will have the ability to lead, develop and inspire staff within their section to work effectively across organisational boundaries to achieve results. This candidate must demonstrate their ability to be innovative, collaborative and use a risk and evidence-based approach to manage complex matters including managing under performance where required. 
Risk – demonstrated strategic, planning, analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to assess and manage risk. 
Financial Accountabilities – as per approved project budgets and financial delegations. 
People Accountabilities – this role includes responsibilities for formal staff supervision. 

Salary offered will be between $141,487 - $167,513 per annum depending on skills and experience. In addition, 15.4% superannuation will be paid.

Roles are offered on an Ongoing/Non-Ongoing basis, with Non-Ongoing roles offered for an initial period of up to 12 months, with the possibility of one extension up to an additional 12 months.

Applications close on 7 November 2025 at 11:30pm (AEDT).

Applications are to be submitted via the Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission Careers page.

Sydney Olympic Park, New South Wales



About the Company

Join a prominent and well-established Australian retailer and wholesaler in a dynamic consumer goods market. With a strong national presence and a reputation for providing high-quality, innovative products, this business is a prominent player in a thriving sector. Focused on a forward-thinking approach, they are committed to operational excellence and continuous improvement, and are seeking a skilled professional to be a part of their ongoing growth.


Role Description

This is an exceptional opportunity for a proactive and hands-on Financial Analyst who thrives on understanding the inner workings of a business. This is not a standard, back office accounting position; it's a high impact, investigative role where you will be instrumental in analysing the operational performance of each individual store. You'll be responsible for deep diving into core cost drivers like wages, overheads, and rent to determine where budgets have been met or exceeded. Your analysis and communication will directly influence critical operational decisions.

This is a permanent, full-time position located at the Sydney Olympic Park office. It offers a competitive salary commensurate with the individual's qualifications and experience.


Key Responsibilities

Conduct in depth analysis of the key operational cost drivers across all stores, including wages, overheads, and rent.
Investigate and analyse labour costs for permanent, part time, and temporary staff to understand performance against budgets.
Prepare and analyse financial results from an operational standpoint, providing clear and concise commentary on variances between actual performance and monthly forecasts.
Communicate key findings and actionable insights to senior leadership and the board, highlighting areas of concern and potential solutions.
Collaborate with operational teams to understand the reasons behind cost overruns, such as rostering inefficiencies.
Contribute to the ongoing development and improvement of financial reporting tools and processes.
Assist in budget and forecast preparations, ensuring accuracy and alignment with operational performance objectives.


Qualifications & Skills

Excellent attention to detail and a robust, adaptable nature.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, with a focus on investigating underlying drivers.
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present complex financial data to non finance stakeholders.
Advanced proficiency in Excel, SAP, and Power BI.
A flexible and adaptable approach to work in a dynamic, fast paced retail environment.
A relevant bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting.
A CPA/CA qualification is highly regarded but not essential.

A hands on, non BAU role with a focus on investigation and problem solving.
The opportunity to directly influence business decisions and contribute to operational efficiency.
A permanent position with a competitive salary.
The chance to work with a market leader in a growing industry.
